samples.ui
Class View

java.lang.Object
  samples.ui.View
Direct Known Subclasses:
CommunityView, PagedView
public class View
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements the concept of a view. See the documentation for the ViewCanvas class for more details.

See Also:
ViewCanvas

setWaiting

public void setWaiting(boolean w)
Set the idle state of this instance. If the argument is true, then an animated progess bar is displayed at the bottom of this view. If the argument is false , then the progress bar is turned off.

Parameters:
w - Whether or not this instance is idle.

isWaiting

Return whether or not this instance is idle.

getFirstFocusable

protected Component getFirstFocusable()
Returns the first focusable component in the View (listed vertically, from top of bottom).

Returns:
The first focusable component in the view

getLastFocusable

protected Component getLastFocusable()
Returns the last focusable component in the View (listed vertically, from top of bottom).

Returns:
The last focusable component in the view

getNextFocusable

protected Component getNextFocusable(Component cur)
Given a component in the View, returns the next focusable component (listed vertically, from top of bottom). If there isn't a "next" one, then wraps the focus back around to the top and returns the first focusable component in the view.

Returns:
The next focusable component in the view

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(int key)
Handle key presses. If a subclass overrides this method, it should always make a call to the superclass implementation to avoid unexpected behavior.

Parameters:
key - The key code for the key that was pressd.

handleFocusChanged

public void handleFocusChanged()
Called when child widget focus changes, in case Views would like to add special behavior. View's implementation does nothing, subclasses must override.

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(int key)
Handle key releases. If a subclass overrides this method, it should always make a call to the superclass implementation to avoid unexpected behavior.

Parameters:
key - The key code for the key that was pressd.

leftSoftButtonPressed

public void leftSoftButtonPressed(java.lang.String label)
Callback method for left soft button presses. The base implementation of this method does nothing. Subclasses need to override it to achieve useful behavior.

rightSoftButtonPressed

public void rightSoftButtonPressed(java.lang.String label)
Callback method for right soft button presses. The base implementation of this method does nothing. Subclasses need to override it to achieve useful behavior.
